channel.title: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]
channel.description:
[u][b]MergeRAR[/b][/u]
[code=Batch]@echo off echo Welcome to MergeRAR! pause set /P rar="RAR Filename: " set /P img="Picture Filename: " set /P out="Output Filename: " copy /b %img% + %rar% %out% pause cls exit[/code]
1] Copy and paste into a text file 2] "Save as..." with the .bat extention 3] Put in same folder as both the archive and JPG image 4] Run and follow directions! [b]Be sure to use file extensions! (i.e. "archive.rar")[/b]
Then bam! You have now hidden a RAR archive within a JPG :D [b]Be Careful![/b], it might raise some eyebrows if your image file is >100 MB
[b]Example:[/b] [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/2dhi9so.jpg[/img] http://i53.tinypic.com/2dhi9so.jpg
Save and open with WinRAR to view the archive

item.title: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:12, topic:399880”][quote author=Kurisu link=topic=496991.msg3634874#msg3634874 date=1308521586]
It combines a RAR file into a JPG and outputs a JPG Image, so if you view the image, it looks like a normal image, but if you open it with WinRAR, it has the archive within it
[/quote]
So basically it hides files?[/quote]to me it sounds like an awesome idea, you could have like a preview for what’s inside the rar file.

item.title: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

I’m not too fancy with batch, I wouldn’t know how to allow the user to input the correct file names, but I’ll look into it
It was easy enough

@echo off echo Welcome to MergeRAR! pause set /P rar="RAR Filename: " set /P img="Picture Filename: " set /P out="Output Filename: " copy /b %img% + %rar% %out% pause cls exit

Read full topic

item.title: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Why wouldn’t you just perform the copy operation yourself if you are going to write it in C++? Then at least it would work on multiple platforms. If you are just going to call ‘system’ then you might as well just write this as a batch file.

Read full topic
item.source: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]

item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

You just convert the string to a C string since system() takes a C string as its parameter.

std::string com = "example"; const char * eg = com.c_str();

item.title: MergeRAR [Hide RAR files in JPG images!]
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

MergeRAR

@echo off echo Welcome to MergeRAR! pause set /P rar="RAR Filename: " set /P img="Picture Filename: " set /P out="Output Filename: " copy /b %img% + %rar% %out% pause cls exit

1] Copy and paste into a text file
2] “Save as…” with the .bat extention
3] Put in same folder as both the archive and JPG image
4] Run and follow directions!
Be sure to use file extensions! (i.e. “archive.rar”)

Then bam! You have now hidden a RAR archive within a JPG
Be Careful!, it might raise some eyebrows if your image file is >100 MB

Example:

Save and open with WinRAR to view the archive
